alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 11:03AM EDT until April 24 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Sturgeon River near Alston affecting Houghton and Baraga Counties. Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt affecting Marquette County. East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Michigamme River near Witch Lake affecting Dickinson and Marquette Counties. Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint) affecting Iron County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... South Branch Ontonagon near Ewen affecting Ontonagon County. Sturgeon River near Nahma Junction affecting Delta County. .Heavy rain will fall increasing runoff into rivers that will increase flows which will reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY, APRIL 24... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Michigamme River near Witch Lake. * WHEN...Until Monday, April 24. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flood waters cover significant portions of County Road LG between M-95 and Michigamme Dam. Houses near Bengtson Bridge in South Republic are further impacted by flood waters * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:10 AM CDT Sunday /10:10 AM EDT Sunday/ the stage was 9.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:10 AM CDT Sunday /10:10 AM EDT Sunday/ was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 10.7 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall Tuesday evening. It will rise to 10.6 feet Wednesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.0 feet on 04/27/2019. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 900 PM CDT /1000 PM EDT/.
